text: making Uncle Sam's clothes building a
better robot and mining for bitcoins
good morning this is the New York Times
minute one of the world's biggest
clothing buyers it's the United States
government everything from airport
security uniforms to camouflage pants
are being made in plants like this one
in Haiti a times investigation found
problems in several factories including
child labor and unsafe working
conditions in Florida this weekend the
DARPA Robotics Challenge of the 16
humanoid robots it was shaft from Japan
who proved superior but the fan-favorite
wild cat and a story from this weekend's
times Bitcoin has become this incredible
speculative mania the speculative
currency may be online but it still
requires a fair bit of real-world
infrastructure in Iceland rows and rows
of computer servers run complex
algorithms to virtually mine for
bitcoins
